page.title: 20Recreation
page.content:
Over 50 years ago the New Quay was a busy quayside with many foreign ships docking there.As fewer ships used the quay side the area became run down, buildings were left empty and the land derelict. If you go down to the New Quay today you will see many changes are taking place.The old buildings are being restored.The Northumberland Arms Hotel in 1808 and once used as the Duke of Northumberland's Town house is a popular licensed hotel.Ithas it's stonework cleaned and is modernising bedrooms that have not been used for years, so that people can stay in them. Two other hotels nearby, the Chain Locker and the Port Hole have been retored and are now open for drinks and pub meals.
by Claire Haddock
